nodes.bodyText: We can reject local frontier transactions whose gas price is too low? Why do we do that?
I thought we want to be very accepting of local transactions. For example, miners submit payout transactions to their own node with a very low gas price.

Well, the behaviour of frontier transactions become the same as it was before. Those use cases are still covered by the --min-gas-price endpoint. Since the actual price of frontier transactions is fixed we can reject those if the price is below the configured --min-gas-price
Ah ok. Then it's not an issue with the diff of this PR but something that's worth discussing about the existing behavior.
